scenarioDescription:
The HD 72659 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 72659 is a star with 1.43 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.46 times its radius. It is located 169.26 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 72659 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 72659 system


HD 72659 b

HD 72659 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2003-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 4.75 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 72659 b is 1224.300 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 72659 b is 13.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 72659 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 72659, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 72659 - System With 1 Exoplanet
